episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the first use of the word 'avocado' by a pirate, a Puerto Rican island where monkeys roam free while humans eat in cages, a peculiar medieval Italian tradition involving prostitutes racing around city walls, and a member of the Romanov royal family living as an artist in Hastings.

facts.fact: The first man to use the word avocado in English was a pirate.
There's a Puerto Rican island where monkeys roam free, but the humans have to eat their meals in cages.
In 14th century Italy, if you wanted to insult a nearby city, you would send all your prostitutes to take part in a running race around their walls.
A member of the Romanov royal family, Prince Rostislav Romanov, lives in Hastings as a painter.
